Tomato Late Blight.about_infection: Late blight is a devastating disease caused by the oomycete pathogen Phytophthora infestans. It affects tomatoes and can spread rapidly in cool, wet conditions.
treatment_steps: Apply fungicides containing copper or mancozeb.
prevention_methods: Ensure good air circulation in the garden.

Tomato Leaf Mold.about_infection: Leaf mold is a fungal disease caused by the pathogen Fulvia fulva. It primarily affects tomato foliage and thrives in warm and humid conditions.
treatment_steps: Apply fungicides containing copper or chlorothalonil.
Ensure proper ventilation in the greenhouse.
prevention_methods: Water at the base to avoid wetting foliage.

Tomato Leaf Spot.about_infection: Septoria leaf spot is a fungal disease caused by the pathogen Septoria lycopersici. It affects tomato leaves and spreads through splashing water and infected plant debris.
treatment_steps: Apply fungicides containing copper or mancozeb.
Ensure proper plant spacing for air circulation.
prevention_methods: Water at the base to avoid splashing.
Mulch around plants to prevent soil contact.
Prune lower branches for better air circulation.

Tomato Healthy.about_infection: No specific disease detected. The plant is healthy.
prevention_methods: Regularly inspect plants for signs of diseases.
